intro: Polyalthia suaveolens var. gabonica, commonly known as the Gaboon polyalthia, is a flowering plant native to central and eastern Africa. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are small and white, often arranged in panicles, and emit a sweet, aromatic scent. This species is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
